New Records: Travis Head becomes the third Australian after Ricky Ponting and Adam Gilchrist to score a century in a World Cup final.
Virat Kohli is now the stand-alone record holder for the most one-day international (ODI) centuries with 50.
Key Match Events: Cummins winning the toss and electing to field was a masterstroke as the pitch proved to be slow.
India looked to threaten a comeback after rocking Australia for 47 for 3, but Head and Marnus Labuschagne constructed a match-turning 192-run partnership.
Australia secured a sixth ODI World Cup title.
Mitchell Starc took 3 wickets for 55 runs.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 wickets for 43 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Pat Cummins: 'This is the top of the mountain.'
Pat Cummins: 'We saved our best for last and a couple of big-match players stood up.'
Rohit Sharma: 'We tried everything we could, but it wasn’t meant to be.'
Rohit Sharma: 'Twenty or 30 more runs would have been good.'
Rohit Sharma: 'The pitch definitely improved under the lights.'
Prime Minister Narendra Modi: 'Your talent and determination through the World Cup was noteworthy. You've played with great spirit and brought immense pride to the nation.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Australia’s Pat Cummins and teammates celebrate winning the 2023 ICC ODI World Cup trophy.
Australia beat India in the World Test Championship final in England before retaining the Ashes.
Virat Kohli named Player of the Tournament with 765 runs, three hundreds, and a record 50 ODI centuries.
